decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing Karador, Ghost Chieftain's ability to cast creatures from the graveyard at a reduced cost to assemble powerful combos and control the board. It includes a variety of creatures with enter-the-battlefield effects, sacrifice outlets, and tutors to facilitate generating value and assembling key combos quickly. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies while setting up its own win conditions through combos like Boonweaver Giant + Pattern of Rebirth or Reveillark + Karmic Guide. Additionally, the mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy by providing the necessary colors and enabling ramp to quickly cast the deck's powerful creatures and spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient and disruptive spells along with powerful creatures to control the game and pressure the opponent. By running a mix of countermagic, removal, and card draw, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while securing its own advantage. The deck also includes a package of powerful creatures with abilities that can impact the board state and provide additional utility. By combining these elements, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent, forcing them to react to the threats presented and ultimately controlling the pace and outcome of the game.

This Tasigur, the Golden Fang Control deck focuses on manipulating the board and controlling the game through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck includes a wide range of interactive spells such as Counterspell, Cryptic Command, and Force of Will to disrupt opponents' strategies. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Dig Through Time to maintain a steady flow of resources. With efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Damnation, alongside versatile card selection tools like Brainstorm and Mystical Tutor, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents while ultimately establishing board control and closing out the game with its strong late-game threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' plays and controlling the game through counterspells, bounce spells, and card advantage. It aims to protect its commander, Vendilion Clique, while using powerful spells like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Control Magic to dominate the battlefield. The deck also includes various utility lands like Cavern of Souls and Maze of Ith to further control the board and protect its key pieces. By efficiently managing resources and outmaneuvering opponents, the deck looks to establish a dominant position and slowly grind out a victory through attrition and careful decision-making.

This deck focuses on utilizing Anafenza, the Foremost as an aggressive Commander in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The key concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with a combination of disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Inquisition of Kozilek while also deploying efficient threats like Tarmogoyfs, Dark Confidant, and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Path to Exile, Fatal Push, and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, the deck features powerful card advantage engines like Liliana of the Veil and Phyrexian Arena to generate incremental advantage over time. Overall, the main strategy is to apply consistent pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the Food Chain combo with Prossh, Skyraider of Kher as the commander. Key cards like Food Chain, Eternal Witness, and Phyrexian Tower allow for infinite creature mana generation, which can then be used to cast Prossh repeatedly for a massive army of tokens. Other supporting cards like Birthing Pod, Skullclamp, and Purphoros, God of the Forge help enhance the combo's effectiveness and provide additional win conditions. The mana base is well-tailored to support the combo strategy with a mix of fetch lands, dual lands, and mana producing creatures. Overall, the deck is designed to quickly ramp up and overwhelm opponents with a powerful combo finish.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering and disrupting opponent's spells while developing card advantage and card selection through draw spells like Brainstorm and dig spells like Dig Through Time. Narset, Enlightened Master allows for powerful spells to be cast for free whenever she attacks, making it crucial to protect her and ensure she can consistently connect with the opponent. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells to deal with threats on the board and powerful planeswalkers to further solidify its control over the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the color requirements of the deck's spells and ensure consistency in casting them.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and disruption while utilizing Nin, the Pain Artist's ability to draw cards and deal damage to control the board. It includes a mix of counter spells such as Counterspell, Force of Will, and Cryptic Command, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Vendilion Clique and Venser, Shaper Savant to provide additional control and disruption. By disrupting their opponent's strategy and drawing cards with Nin's ability, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and establish control of the game to secure victory.
